system.description:
Also at 4th level, as soon as battle commences your mind focuses on manipulating the creatures before you. At the end of another creature’s turn, you can use your reaction to activate a battle dirge. This battle dirge replaces any currently activated battle dirge. Replacing an activated battle dirge does not require expending a use of @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.el6nhqunz3mytxw6]{Mind-Numbing Chant} if it has no target yet.

In addition, choose one of the following.

  • Your battle dirges no longer require concentration.

  • Your battle dirges spread like a mind-virus; when a creature fails a save against your battle dirge, or chooses to accept the dirge without making a save, you may immediately target another creature to affect with the same battle dirge. You may do this a total number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus, not including the initial dirge.

  • You learn an additional battle dirge that does not count against the number of battle dirges you can know. When choosing this battle dirge, you are treated as having 4 more dirgesinger levels for the purpose of meeting its prerequisites. If you change this Battle Dirge Focus, you forget the additional battle dirge.

Whenever you gain a dirgesinger level, you may change your Battle Dirge Focus.
